posts.post: An interesting title
Not a gun gang meme
True story.

Depressive phase has started.
Glad I caught it early on so I'm prepared now.  But the mania was a good ride too.. I'll miss it. Oh boy here we go again.  *Hello darkness my old friend*
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in the post is adaptive, and is comprised of the writer feeling glad, because he caught the transition into the depressive phase of his bipolar condition early enabling him to prepare for it, showcasing self-care behavior. Additionally, the preparation exhibits self-acceptance regarding the future depressive phase to come. The maladaptive state is indicated by the depressive affect starting to take hold of the writer, following the transition into the depressive episode.

B-S.highlighted_evidence: Glad I caught it early on so I'm prepared now

posts.post: Haha look

Elon Musk keeps his phone wallpaper as plain dark black.
That way when you open it there's less of a mental distraction.

Which of two teachers should I ask for an LoR?
My English teachers who's obviously great with English and *loves* me saying I'm one in a million  *OR*  My Computer Science teacher who still likes me but not more than others (and I just got the highest in the last exam), and also she's the head of department of Computer Science  I'm an Indian applying at Ashoka University for Computer Science, and that University is pretty new but really selective and renowned for implementing Western techniques of universities more than any other in the country possibly.
posts.Post Summary: The self state present in the post is an adaptive one. It centers the desire to get accepted into a prestigious university.  The writer behaves in a self-care way by applying to the school, making him ask for help from the forum, acting in a relating way. He needs advice on choosing between two different options for recommendations, stating his teachers love him, hence viewing them relatedly.

A.highlighted_evidence: My English teachers who's obviously great with English and *loves* me saying I'm one in a million

B-S.highlighted_evidence: I'm an Indian applying at Ashoka University for Computer Science,

B-O.highlighted_evidence: Which of two teachers should I ask for an LoR?

C-O.Category: (1) Perception of the other as related
C-O.highlighted_evidence: My English teachers who's obviously great with English and *loves* me saying I'm one in a million

D.highlighted_evidence: I'm an Indian applying at Ashoka University for Computer Science, and that University is pretty new but really selective

posts.post: *an old 2019 meme* showing up one one last time before the decade ends
It's everyday bro
The memes that never die.

Saved my best friend's life
Alright so me and her met 4 years ago and I can't possibly explain how much she meant to me and how I literally grew into her personality  But for this year I felt like she was ignoring and estranging herself from me (which broke my heart but also taught me lessons of tough love, but that's a story for another day).   Here's a post I made about it sometime ago:-  https://www.reddit.com/r/teenagers/comments/e08sd6/formerish_best_friend_distancing_herself_from_me/?utm_medium=android_app&utm_source=share  But yesterday night (she is halfway across the world from me rn), she- she confided in me. She told me about everything that had been bothering her. Her parents are arguing and may divorce each other, her mother hates her and even physically hits her, and her dad won't let her go to college next year if her mom leaves...   All of this, naturally, took a toll on her. You can't imagine the terror I myself felt when she told me all this. I did know about it but that was years ago, and I felt disqualified as a friend to support her in this with her distancing from me and all.   But yesterday night she came clean. And she was suicidal. She threatened me about jumping into the Thames right then. But it was me, who touched her heart. In a world where no one understood us, we understood each other. I saved her life.   And the best part - for a person who puts up a tough act and has deep trust issues - she thanked me. She told me she was grateful to have me. And she'd do the same for me.   She's still my friend. I'm not all alone.   Anyway I just had to tell someone about this, you guys seemed ideal. This has been me, and till next time, peace!
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in the post is adaptive. It follows the writer's relating behavior exhibited when he saved his friend's life by speaking with her. During this saving, the writer felt what helped was that they understood each other, viewing her as related. The experience and the closeness resulting from it lead him to view himself in a more accepting way, thinking he is not all alone, and to feel proud of himself. following his relatedness needs, he shared the experience online. the maladaptive self state is centered around the cognition of his best friend as detached. This cognition is backed by the friend's detached behavior, and the writer feels heartbroken and lonely because of it. through it all, he still criticizes himself for not asking her sooner about her situation.

A.highlighted_evidence: I saved her life.   And the best part - for a person who puts up a tough act and has deep trust issues - she thanked me.

C-O.Category: (1) Perception of the other as related
C-O.highlighted_evidence: In a world where no one understood us, we understood each other

D.highlighted_evidence: Anyway I just had to tell someone about this, you guys seemed ideal.

A.highlighted_evidence: felt like she was ignoring and estranging herself from me (which broke my heart

B-O.highlighted_evidence: I felt disqualified as a friend to support her in this with her distancing from me and all.

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I did know about it but that was years ago, and I felt disqualified as a friend to support her in this with her distancing from me and all.

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: she was ignoring and estranging herself from me

My little guy giving y'all a hug
Got your nose
How do you small talk?
posts.Post Summary: The self state in this post centers the desire to feel related to others, exhibited by asking for tips from the forum, showing relating behavior.

posts.post:
Had everything I wanted but turns out that's not what I wanted
I had everything. I had great friends. People who care about me. I had the love of my life. I had good relations. I was happy. But deep inside, I still felt empty. It's as if I was in pain for so long, I got addicted to it. I made it my home. And even though I had everything I ever wanted in that pain, despite having it all, I chose to go back to the pain just because it was the only thing now that comforted me and made me feel ok.
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in the post is maladaptive, and is centered around the writer's expectation that his competence needs will not be met, and he will not be able to keep his adaptive situation going on. he is behaving in a self sabotaging way because of this expectation, giving up on relationships with others. it seems this expectation also gives way to a self criticizing cognition of self, viewing himself as addicted to pain. this self sabotaging behavior causes depressive affect, a feeling of emptiness. The adaptive self state is mainly in the past, exhibited by saying he felt very loved back then, by great friends and romantic partner who were viewed as relating, loving.

A.highlighted_evidence: But deep inside, I still felt empty.

B-S.highlighted_evidence: I chose to go back to the pain

C-S.highlighted_evidence: It's as if I was in pain for so long, I got addicted to it

D.Category: (6) Expectation that competence needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: even though I had everything I ever wanted in that pain, despite having it all, I chose to go back to the pain

posts.post: Legends will be in crisis they said.
Fart rights
How will they beat the villains now without any motivational speech telling Barry to run faster?

I don't mean to brag but..
I got 2 Reddit followers

Almost fucking died.
First anyone else hallucinates? I did twice before. I can tell it's not real, but I just see a person who I'm thinking of in a negative context. Like if I feel guilty for something I did to someone, my guilt and perception will appear in the form of the person I'm thinking of, staring silently into my soul from the corner of the room. Now this had already happened twice before, but both the times I was calm and looking at them.   Yesterday night I was chatting with my friend about all this and I brought up a person who I shouted really bad at once. The next thing - she only with her head is staring at me from the corner. The head wasn't gorily cut off or anything it was just that I simply didn't focus on the limbs.   I tried to look away. Move. Even text her about this. But I couldn't. And the more I tried, the worse it got.   My eyes were fixated on hers. I was hyper manic throughout the day and it was one of the best days of my life till that point. But then I was having a full on panic attack. My hands and legs were violently shaking. My teeth were clattering. I was really cold yet the blanket was at my legs and I still couldn't pull it. I got a fever.   I really felt like I was dying.
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in the post is maladaptive. it centers the self criticizing cognition of self of the writer, that manifests in the form of the face of the other by means of hallucination. the self criticizing follows a fight behavior by the writer, where he does something he regrets. because he neglected himself and gave in to a hyper manic episode, the hallucinations started to appear. during the hallucination, the writer could not possibly look away or move, showing how his autonomous needs are not met. This leads the writer to feel extremely anxious. The adaptive self state is comprised of the writer's desire to feel related to others, searching for relatability by posting this online, and of relating behavior showcased when he spoke to his friends about this.

B-O.highlighted_evidence: Yesterday night I was chatting with my friend about all this

A.highlighted_evidence: then I was having a full on panic attack

B-S.highlighted_evidence: I was hyper manic throughout the day and it was one of the best days of my life till that point. But then I was having a full on panic attack. My hands and legs were violently shaking. My teeth were clattering. I was really cold yet the blanket was at my legs and I still couldn't pull it

B-O.highlighted_evidence: I brought up a person who I shouted really bad at once

C-S.highlighted_evidence: if I feel guilty for something I did to someone, my guilt and perception will appear in the form of the person I'm thinking of, staring silently into my soul from the corner of the room

D.Category: (4) Expectation that autonomy needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: I tried to look away. Move. Even text her about this. But I couldn't. And the more I tried, the worse it got

posts.post: I siszoned the girl who brozoned me for 4 years (it's all chill though) AMA
I wish that every time someone roasted someone else for using light mode, they'd lose their eyes and live the rest of their lives in dark mode.

timeline_summary: Throughout the timeline, the writer showed a transition between mostly maladaptive self states, caused by his depressive/manic phases, but when he is in remission, the adaptive self states become more dominant, in correlation with his wellbeing and functioning.
